sub_title: Marine Sciences Engineer | Marine Biotechnologist & Bioeconomist| Intern at Wageningen University Research
summary:
SMATI Hadjer is a marine sciences and coastal planning engineer, specializing in marine biology and marine ecology with a focus on marine biotechnology. Currently, she is pursuing a master's degree in applied economics at the European Institute of Marine Studies and the Agrocampus Institute in Brittany, with a specialization in the sea, environment, and agriculture.

Marine Biotechnology is a field gaining significant importance, combining various biotechnologies (white, green, red, and blue) with synthetic biology to create sustainable management solutions for genetic resources and food production. By integrating cutting-edge technologies with marine resources, it aims to develop valuable goods and services.

Hadjer's decision to pursue both marine biotechnology and applied economics was motivated by several factors. Firstly, the economic challenges posed by marine biotechnology and agricultural revolutions worldwide, in both northern and southern regions, require a comprehensive understanding of their impact and potential contributions to sustainable development. Secondly, her dual training allows her to analyze the broader implications of blue biotechnologies. 

Hadjer's primary interests encompass:

1) Algae Valorization: focusing on the extraction and utilization of bioactive compounds, including pigments, lipids, proteins and amino acids, polysaccharides, bioactive peptides, antimicrobial compounds, and biofertilizers. Fascinated by the characterization of polymers derived from algae. this approach contributes significantly to the development of a sustainable bio-based economy.

2) Marine Bioprospecting: aims to explore the marine environment to identify novel genetic resources with commercial potential. Can lead to discoveries of new drugs, enzymes, and functional ingredients for various industries.

3) Fisheries Management: regulating and conserving fish populations to ensure their long-term viability and maintain ecological balance within marine ecosystems.

These areas of interest serve as the foundation for Hadjer's potential research tasks, reflecting her personal motivation and dedication to advancing marine biotechnology and sustainable utilization of marine resources.

profile_positions.company: L'École Nationale Supérieure des Sciences de la Mer et de l'Aménagement du Littoral (ENSSMAL)
profile_positions.description:
The macroalgae among the phyla of interest to researchers, the valuation of algae had been oriented towards the source of production of phycocolloid and compounds with many interests in the world. 
The algale flora of the algerian coast remains largely unexplored, we carried out this work to 
better know the species of macrophytes distributed on the algerian coast whose biotechnological interest, in order to establish an inventory and to select the taxa which can be highlighted , lastly determine the economic opportunities for the development of this sector in Algeria.
The analysis carried out within the framework of this Master's degree was based on a bibliographical study, taking into account the context linked to COVID 19, which prevented us from carrying out all the activities initially planned (extraction of minerals). The present Master's degree is therefore conceived as a preliminary evaluation of the potential for the valorisation of marine macro-algae in Algeria. This analysis has enabled a first inventory of marine macro-algae species of biotechnological interest to be made. An attempt to evaluate the needs of the Algerian consumer and the position of Algeria in the world macro-algae market was also carried out, followed by a stage in which standard sheets were drawn up, based on mental maps and graphic design (originality of the work). 
Finally, this work enabled us to select the taxa that could meet these needs according to the criteria of abundance, environment, etc. 
We constructed the analysis matrix (external factors: strengths and weaknesses, internal factors: opportunities and threats) to take stock of the main development areas of the marine macro-algae sector in Algeria, the good practices to be perpetuated, the obstacles and the avenues for improvement to be followed.
At the end we carried out a feasibility study for the valorisation of the species, and a study on the environmental impact.
profile_positions.title: Inventory and characterisation of a  sample of marine algae of biotechnological interest in Algeria.

profile_positions.description:
The present study focused on the evaluation of biological and physico-chemical quality of the water used at Candia Tchin-Lait in Algiers. The quality of the water was estimated by measuring the physico-chemical parameters that must comply with the standards recommended by the WHO or Algerian standards.
Carrying out a study in process engineering on the operation of the devices responsible for filtering water in order to eliminate undesirable minerals by reverse osmosis.
and microbiological control of water, wastes and products, as well as methods of obtaining and packaging these products.

Private tutoring in mathematics and English

profile_positions.description: The programme dealt with marine biology, biogeography, fisheries and terrestrial ecology in addition to the marine aspects. Numerous field and sea trips were proposed (north-western side of the Algerian coastline, from Algiers to Tlemcen), visits to fisheries, surveys among fishermen, identification of species (fauna and flora).
